item.title: Shopify 推动加拿大股指突破 25,000 点，涨幅创历史新高
item.description: 由于信息技术股率先反弹，加拿大股票基准首次突破 25,000 点。【原文：Canada’s stocks benchmark crossed above 25,000 points for the first time as information technology stocks spearheaded the rally.】

item.title: 德国新任财政部长排除冻结联邦资金的可能性
item.description: 德国新任财政部长驳斥了柏林政治动荡将引发资金冻结的担忧，承诺联邦政府在二月提前大选前的几周内完全有能力正常运转。【原文：Germany’s new finance minister dismissed fears the political turmoil in Berlin will trigger a funding freeze, pledging the federal government will be fully capable of functioning in the weeks before February’s early election.】

item.title: 哈萨克斯坦再次错失欧佩克+减产目标
item.description: 哈萨克斯坦在 10 月份大幅降低了石油产量，其主要油田之一因维护工作而关闭，但仍未能实现欧佩克+减产目标。【原文：Kazakhstan lowered oil production sharply in October, with maintenance work closing one of its main fields, but still failed to meet its OPEC+ output cuts target.】

item.title: 化肥生产商马赛克因佛罗里达州飓风影响利润而下滑
item.description: 化肥生产商马赛克公司（Mosaic Co.）的股价创下了 18 个月来的最大跌幅，此前美国多次遭受飓风袭击，销售价格下跌，导致该公司的利润和销售额大幅低于预期。【原文：Shares of fertilizer producer Mosaic Co. fell the most in 18 months after multiple hurricanes in the US and lower selling prices led to sharply lower-than-expected profit and sales.】

item.title: 美元在特朗普推动下反弹，华尔街一致看涨
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）赢得总统大选一周后，美元的反弹势头愈演愈烈，对其他货币造成了严重破坏，并促使华尔街策略师为美元的进一步上涨做好准备。【原文：The US dollar’s rally is gaining momentum a week after Donald Trump’s presidential victory, wreaking havoc on other currencies and pushing Wall Street strategists to brace for further gains.】

item.title: 安大略省省长提出将墨西哥排除在外的美加贸易协议
item.description: 加拿大最大省份的省长希望加拿大与美国谈判自己的贸易协定，除非墨西哥在中国进口问题上与北美伙伴保持一致。【原文：The premier of Canada’s largest province wants the country to negotiate its own trade agreement with the US, unless Mexico aligns itself with its North American partners on Chinese imports.】

item.title: ValueAct 以 10 亿美元被动持有 Meta 公司股份
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，ValueAct Capital Management 公司已入股 Facebook 母公司 Meta Platforms Inc.【原文：ValueAct Capital Management has taken a $1 billion stake in Facebook parent Meta Platforms Inc., according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国人对移动银行和短期资金的依赖度上升
item.description: 美国联邦存款保险公司（Federal Deposit Insurance Corp）的最新数据显示，在拥有银行账户的美国家庭中，48.3%的家庭主要使用手机办理日常银行业务，这一比例创下历史新高。再加上那些喜欢使用电脑或平板电脑的家庭，到 2023 年，每三个美国家庭中就有两个以上喜欢使用数字银行。【原文：Of American households with bank accounts — and that’s nearly all of them — a record 48.3% primarily use their mobile phones for routine banking, according to new data from the Federal Deposit Insurance Corp. Combined with those who prefer a computer or tablet, more than two out of three US households preferred digital banking in 2023.】

item.title: 美联储调查显示美国消费者通胀前景略有下降
item.description: 纽约联邦储备银行的一项调查显示，家庭的通胀预期略有下降，个人收入前景保持稳定，工人对就业市场更有信心。【原文：Households’ inflation expectations declined slightly, the outlook for personal income held steady and workers are feeling more confident about the job market, according to a Federal Reserve Bank of New York survey.】

item.title: 尼日利亚寻求沙特阿拉伯提供 50 亿美元贸易融资
item.description: 尼日利亚正在寻求沙特阿拉伯提供 50 亿美元的贸易融资，为其经济改革计划提供资金支持。【原文：Nigeria is seeking a $5 billion trade facility from Saudi Arabia to shore up capital for its economic reform program.】

item.title: 华尔街 "加息换长息 "大军陷入贷款困境
item.description: 投资者纷纷涌入美国杠杆贷款ETF，押注当选总统唐纳德-特朗普的政策将有可能刺激通胀，推动美联储在更长时间内维持更高利率。【原文：Investors are piling into US leveraged loan ETFs, betting that President-elect Donald Trump’s policies will potentially boost inflation and push the Federal Reserve to keep interest rates higher for longer.】

item.title: 劳资纠纷导致贸易受阻，加拿大下令港口重新启动
item.description: 贾斯汀-特鲁多（Justin Trudeau）政府指示一个独立的劳工委员会结束加拿大最大港口的停工，就像它在 8 月份对铁路部门所做的那样，以避免国内经济出现混乱。【原文：Justin Trudeau’s government directed an independent labor board to end lockouts at Canada’s largest ports, as it did with railways in August, to avoid an economic disruption in the country.】

item.title: 博茨瓦纳多元化发展有望吸引非洲富豪
item.description: 一项新的研究发现，博茨瓦纳正在推动经济多元化，从采矿业转向金融服务业，这使其有能力与毛里求斯竞争，成为非洲高净值个人和家庭的中心。【原文：Botswana’s push to diversify its economy away from mining and into financial services positions it to compete with Mauritius as an African hub for high net-worth individuals and families, a new study has found.】

item.title: 巴金称美联储有能力应对经济变化
item.description: 里士满联邦储备银行行长托马斯-巴尔金说，经济形势良好，这使得美国央行得以降低借贷成本。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Richmond President Thomas Barkin said the economy is in a good place, which has allowed the US central bank to lower borrowing costs.】

item.title: 中国吉利洽谈控制飞行出租车初创公司 Volocopter
item.description: 据熟悉谈判情况的人士透露，中国企业集团吉利正在就收购德国 Volocopter Gmbh 公司的控制权进行深入谈判，这项交易将使这家飞行出租车初创公司免于破产的危险。【原文：Chinese conglomerate Geely is in advanced talks to take control of Germany’s Volocopter Gmbh in a deal that would save the flying taxi startup from potential bankruptcy, according to people familiar with the talks.】

item.title: 特朗普获胜后，花旗银行被疲软的南非兰特拖累
item.description: 花旗集团（Citigroup Inc.【原文：It took less than a week for one of Citigroup Inc.’s recommended Trump trades to sink under water.】

item.title: 英国将减少应对债券购买计划损失的现金缓冲
item.description: 英国央行在放松量化宽松债券购买计划的同时，正在减少其持有的现金缓冲，以防意外损失，英国官员称，此举将为纳税人提供更好的 "性价比"。【原文：The Bank of England is reducing the cash buffer it holds against unexpected losses as it unwinds its quantitative easing bond-buying program, in a move UK officials said would provide taxpayers better “value for money.”】

item.title: 西班牙考克斯公司将以最低价上市
item.description: 根据彭博社看到的交易条款，西班牙水务和能源公司 Cox ABG Group SA 将指导投资者，其首次公开募股的定价将在区间的下限。【原文：Spanish water and energy firm Cox ABG Group SA is guiding investors that its initial public offering will be priced at the bottom end of the range, according to terms of the deal seen by Bloomberg.】

item.title: Meta 推出针对性更弱的广告，以消除欧盟监管机构的担忧
item.description: Meta Platforms Inc. 正在撤回针对欧洲用户的广告定向，以消除欧盟对该公司订阅模式的担忧。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. is rolling back ad targeting for European users in a bid to address European Union concerns over the company’s subscription model.】

item.title: 根据供应商风险规则，科技巨头将面临更多京东审查
item.description: 监管机构周二表示，与英国金融公司合作的大型科技公司将面临更严格的审查，他们制定了期待已久的新规则，以应对关键第三方供应商带来的潜在风险。【原文：Major technology companies working with UK finance firms will face closer scrutiny, regulators said on Tuesday, as they set out long-awaited new rules to tackle potential risks posed by critical third-party suppliers.】

item.title: 塞尔维亚总统武契奇表示马斯克在与特朗普通话时在场
item.description: 塞尔维亚总统亚历山大-武契奇（Aleksandar Vucic）表示，埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）在周日与唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）通电话时在场，并称他与美国当选总统的通话是 "莫大的荣幸"。【原文：Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic signaled that Elon Musk was present during a phone call with Donald Trump on Sunday, calling his phone call with the US president-elect a “great honor.”】

item.title: Netflix 称现在有 7000 万用户观看带有广告的节目
item.description: Netflix 公司称，每月有 7000 万观众观看其带有广告的节目，比 5 月份的总数增加了近一倍。【原文：Netflix Inc. said 70 million viewers are watching its shows with advertising every month, nearly double the total from May.】

item.title: 人工智能初创公司 Writer 在新一轮融资中估值 19 亿美元
item.description: Writer 是一家旨在与 OpenAI 等公司竞争，向企业销售人工智能产品的初创公司，该公司已完成新一轮融资，其估值几乎翻了两番，达到 19 亿美元。【原文：Writer, a startup aiming to compete with the likes of OpenAI to sell artificial intelligence products to businesses, has raised a new round of financing that nearly quadruples its valuation to $1.9 billion.】

item.title: 阿斯利康谈美国增长：中国问题加剧
item.description: 阿斯利康公司（AstraZeneca Plc）正越来越多地将增长的目光投向美国，因为其一度快速扩张的中国业务在一次调查中放缓，使这家制药商的股价受到重创。【原文：AstraZeneca Plc is increasingly looking to the US for growth as its once fast-expanding China business slows amid a probe that has battered the drugmaker’s share price.】

item.title: 即使需求增加，高通公司首席执行官仍认为人工智能芯片不会短缺
item.description: 高通公司（Qualcomm Inc.首席执行官克里斯蒂安诺-阿蒙（Cristiano Amon）表示，即使人工智能智能手机的需求不断增长，人工智能热潮也不会导致类似大流行病期间发生的全球芯片短缺。【原文：Qualcomm Inc. Chief Executive Officer Cristiano Amon said the artificial intelligence boom won’t lead to a global chip shortage similar to what happened during the pandemic, even with demand for AI-enabled smartphones rising.】

item.title: 埃利奥特持有霍尼韦尔 50 多亿美元股份
item.description: 据知情人士透露，激进投资者埃利奥特投资管理公司（Elliott Investment Management）已在工业巨头霍尼韦尔国际公司（Honeywell International Inc.【原文：Activist investor Elliott Investment Management has built a $5 billion-plus position in industrials giant Honeywell International Inc., according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 诺沃格拉茨和温克艾沃斯双胞胎因比特币复兴而财富激增
item.description: 两年前，山姆-班克曼-弗里德（Sam Bankman-Fried）的 FTX 公司突然倒闭，让世界上几位飞黄腾达的加密货币亿万富翁争先恐后地保护自己的财富，以躲避即将到来的监管反弹。【原文：Two years ago, the sudden collapse of Sam Bankman-Fried’s FTX sent several of the world’s high-flying crypto billionaires scrambling to preserve their wealth from the regulatory backlash to come.】

item.title: 美国在线食品价格自科维德事件以来首次出现同比下降
item.description: 10 月份的在线杂货价格比去年同期有所下降，这是自四年多前 Covid 出现以来的首次下降。【原文：Online grocery prices declined in October from a year earlier, the first such drop since the arrival of Covid more than four years ago.】

item.title: 泰森公司预测 2025 年盈利将因鸡肉业务好转而增加
item.description: 泰森食品公司（Tyson Foods Inc.【原文：Tyson Foods Inc. said it expects results to improve next year as a turnaround in the chicken business and rising demand for prepared foods offsets losses in beef.】
